website_summaries.verdict: A well-made fillet knife and sheath suitable for use in the kitchen or the great outdoors.
pros: Stainless-steel blades with comfortable rubber grip
Soft blade that's designed to bend instead of breaking
Knife clicks into the included plastic sheath and stays in place
cons: The knife holds an edge well, but it doesn't come sharpened

customer_reviews.title: Description says US made, box says Made in China
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in the advertising. On two different spots in the description it states "Made in USA". That's the reason I bought this knife, US company with a reputation for quality US made knives. Box just arrived. I flip over packaging and read "Made in China" almost immediately. Will not open it just yet, may return it. Looks like a nice knife. It's probably an excellent knife. But the advertising is just straight up incorrect. I'll be contacting Amazon and possibly Kershaw to address this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Pjsteels

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Warranty
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the knife less than a year ago and I started to have warranty issues. The knife has a limited lifetime warranty but is worth less than the paper it is written on. Firstly, they will not accept a photo of the problem, the knife has to be sent back to them and they want me to pay for shipping so that they can evaluate the problem. Which means that I would be out another 6 or 7 dollars with no guarantee they would replace the knife (cost of knife about 15.00). Then it is unclear whether I would have to pay return shipping. What good is a warranty when the cost of shipping is more than the knife.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Engelson

customer_reviews.title: The Kershaw 9-Inch Fillet Knife with sheath is a good value.
customer_reviews.text: The Kershaw Fillet Knife with sheath is a good value -- quality, performance and cost. The 9-inch blade is very useful for larger fillets, although for small fillets it requires some care during use. The knife "clicks" into the sheath and stays in-place, even when carried in luggage. The knife maintained its edge and was flexible, steady in the handle with a non-slip grip..
customer_reviews.author: Bob W

customer_reviews.title: Excellent long length fillet knife.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at the low price on this fillet knife. I have a few Kershaw pocket knives that I really like so I was quick to jump on this deal. I needed a fillet knife that could handle the big boys and this does the trick. I was able to run the blade along a 20 lb blue cat and take off the fillet in one cut. It's pretty sharp out of the package but a few swipes across the diamond hone and it's a razor. 10/10, I would buy this knife again.
customer_reviews.author: B.T.S.Top Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Super Smooth Cut!
customer_reviews.text: So I got this knife because I was always messing up the skin side on my fish fillets. My dull kitchen knifes just took forever to skin a fish and it looked terrible after I was finished almost like someone took a weed wacker to my fish. Well after I got this fillet knife it was no longer a problem. This knife cuts fish as smooth as butter and its super long so you can cut up just about any size of fillet in one pass.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall Morrison

customer_reviews.title: INCREDIBLE PRODUCT, High Quality, & Fast Shipping!
customer_reviews.text: I am a HUGE Kershaw fan. I have 4 Kershaw pocket knives and I prefer them to the Buck, Gerber, and CKRT pocket knives that I own. Currently this is my highest quality/best Filet Knife that I own. When shopping I was considering getting a Bubba Blade or Gerber brand filet knife and I am glad I didn't because they were 2-4 times more expensive. I have filayed everything from crappie, to bass, to catfish with this knife and it is super sharp and the rubber grip makes it easy to use. 5 STARS, Highly Recommend this product!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa WH

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME KNIFE / incredable price
customer_reviews.text: BUY THIS KNIFE!!! There is no reason to spend 50-$I00 for a fillet knife. bought one of these for filleting Chicken breasts for my restaurant 6 years ago. It is still highly functional but after 6 years of sharping blade size was about 3/4 of original. So I just got another & use the old one as backup. Holds an awesome edge for filleting a 100 breasts at a time. Non slip grip is great. You can't go wrong, KERSHAW BABY!!!
customer_reviews.author: chauncey2

customer_reviews.title: Extremely sharp right out of the package and regaining that exact edge after heavy use takes mere seconds on a diamond whetstone just like the Kershaws I used to carry
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it will lightly rust if sheathed wet and left overnight. The small spots disappeared and stayed gone the day after its first use in the Gulf with near zero effort during post trip gear cleanup the next day. Leave knife out of sheath for both to dry and the rust stays gone. Extremely sharp right out of the package and regaining that exact edge after heavy use takes mere seconds on a diamond whetstone just like the Kershaws I used to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Sisson

customer_reviews.title: Inferior materials used
customer_reviews.text: The belt loop is made of inexpensive brittle plastic. If you aren't in need of a belt loop......you MIGHT be OK with one of these. Otherwise? Me? The belt loop crapped out on me immediately so I can't comment on the blade, sheath or handle. As always.....Amazon returns policy continues to amaze.
customer_reviews.author: Stan McCord

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Great brand at a great price. Very sharp and comfortable to use. Just did this batch of trout yesterday and used it for the first time. Better than allot of more expensive knives.
customer_reviews.author: Kaligirl

customer_reviews.title: Good Fillet Knife
customer_reviews.text: This fillet knife is comfortable in my hand and the blade is easy to sharpen. I wanted a fillet knife with a somewhat flexible blade and a plastic sheath. The knife sort of clicks into the sheath so you know when it is in place. At first I thought the price was a bit high but more than I looked on Amazon, I decided to buy the Kershaw.
customer_reviews.author: Guitar Player

customer_reviews.title: Not sharp on first use
customer_reviews.text: Given other reviewers, I expect this to be very sharp. Mine was not. Also one side was Not beveled and sharpens as much as the other. On my first use I tore up a sea bass trying to filet it. I had to get out a Wet stone and improved the edge.
customer_reviews.author: Cd

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the rust
customer_reviews.text: Comes very dull but sharpens up and holds an edge. Rusted after first use despite filleting and rinsing in fresh water. Decent for the price but I would not buy again. Would rather spend an extra $10 and buy something nicer.
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: good for what you pay
customer_reviews.text: Good knife but the handle isn't very comfortable and the sheath is just plain horribly uncomfortable, it's secure and isn't gonna get cut through but the edges are sharp, I got it because it was cheap and I needed a fillet knife and have had very good experience with other kershaw knives, if I got another cheap fillet knife I'd probably go with a morakniv mora fillet knife.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Mouse

customer_reviews.title: The knife is perfect for birthday gift for a loved one that enjoys finishing
customer_reviews.text: The knife comes sharp and ready for use anytime. It came perfect with a hard case for protection purposes. I now use this knife to fillet any fish bought from the market and it sure does the work much faster and cleaner than the ordinary knives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets dull very fast.
customer_reviews.text: This knife is awsome, but when it's dull it takes time to try to sharpen it back to normal. The knife gets dull very quick. It works to fillet but have to sharpen it 5 times on 1 fish.
customer_reviews.author: Sir senor frog

customer_reviews.title: Great knife, used it recently to filet some Pompano
customer_reviews.text: Great knife, used it recently to filet some Pompano, sharp with just the right amount of flex to get the most out of each fish.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Vineski

customer_reviews.title: Good deal on a good knife
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent price for a quality knife. It is big and I used it to filet 2 red grouper with ease, right out of the package. It has a nice sheath and I am sure it will hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Surprising how good it is
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t expect perfection for this price but with a quick honing out of the package with a steel this thing is perfect. Super knife! Sturdy sheath included.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Not as sharp as I would have thought and I ...
customer_reviews.text: Not as sharp as I would have thought and I cannot seem to get an edge on it with a stone or other sharpeners. have not tried it on too many pieces of meat yet so may be it will be OK.
customer_reviews.author: ralph c.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to sharpen
customer_reviews.text: Strong but flexible and floats! Easy to sharpen. I use for everything from filleting fish to skinning and cleaning deer, pig, and goats.
customer_reviews.author: doityourselfer

customer_reviews.title: Holds an edge
customer_reviews.text: Used it to butcher deer and really like it, especially for de-boning and back straps. If it works for what I used it for then I guess it will work for fish. Whole deer and no need to resharpen.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought because I keep forgetting my knife on the boat or in the tackle box depending what I’m fishing for so I got a few to put everywhere
customer_reviews.author: Sam C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I really like this knife and the positive lock on the sheath. Good blade. It is still sharp after cleaning several catfish and perch.
customer_reviews.author: John Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Great price, used it to carve Thanksiving Turkey. It made clean cuts with ease thin and small slices. Handled well washing in the dishwasher. A little large for the kitchen drawer. I imagine it would work amazingly on actual fish.
customer_reviews.author: TrixieMonoxcide

customer_reviews.title: Poor blade quality
customer_reviews.text: nice look and feel, i guess... but not sharp and won't take a good enough edge for my needs. I would not recomend this to any other Chef of person looking for a sharp enough knife to filet a fish. look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C

customer_reviews.title: Typical Kershaw...AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: I love Kershaw knives and have always carried them. This filet knife is no different. It's very sharp and has the perfect flex in the blade for cutting fillets. This is my No.1 now!
customer_reviews.author: Harbourbug

customer_reviews.title: a bit underwelming.
customer_reviews.text: This knife is made in China not the US, I do not think it holds its edge very well. It is flexible the handle does not slip in my hand while I am using it.
customer_reviews.author: L in KS.

customer_reviews.title: Fillet Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: The fillet knife is perfect for the "master chef", my husband. He says it makes cutting and slicing a breeze. He thoroughly enjoys using it in meal preparation. The price was more than reasonable for such a quality item.
customer_reviews.author: GB Lowrey

customer_reviews.title: Super Sharp
customer_reviews.text: This knife is perfect in all aspects: very sharp, just the right amount of flex, good size for a range of fish, and low cost. It will rust if you leave it all gross and fishy, but just wash and dry it and you will have no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon R.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Really good quality knife. Giftable is a strange rating as I am a chef and even my wife would not buy a knife for me.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: This knife is great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This knife is great for the price. It comes sharp but after i ran it through my AccuSharp 001 Knife Sharpener, it felt like it cut cut bread so thin, you could only see one side. If you want a good quality filet knife with a sheath, and still have money in your pocket, buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Mathew

customer_reviews.title: Fillet Knife fave
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product fillet knife. I use it often to remove skin from Salmon. The safety cover is approximate as it is very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: CaramelQT

customer_reviews.title: I use it to skin large, fresh sides of ...
customer_reviews.text: I use it to skin large, fresh sides of salmon for filet; few times a month, nothing of frequent repetition. It's not razor sharp, but quite sharp enough for the task. Fitment into the sheath is a bit clumsy, but it's on my kitchen knife bar, so not a concern for me.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Beauty!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knife for dipnetting season in Alaska. I ended up getting my limit, but that meant that this knife had it's work cut out for it. It kept it's edge and cuts like butter. It's got a comfortable, easy to hold on to handle and the right amount of flex. I've only used it for a season so far, so I can't speak for it's longevity, but I expect that with proper care and maintenance, it'll last for years. I would recommend this knife to fishermen/fisherwomen out there who have some big salmon in the cooler!
customer_reviews.author: gjhartma

customer_reviews.title: Great value and quality blade
customer_reviews.text: Was just going to use this for cut bait but was to nice just to use it for that.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Gabinos gift
customer_reviews.text: Got for a gift for guide in baja.so hope it's good.looks good
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great knife
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp and great fill in hand. Did great cutting up a tuna :)
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Rusted, brittle, broke, not true stainless steel!
customer_reviews.text: Should’ve taken a picture of the knife. Used it on my boat for cutting fish after catching them. It started rusting pretty bad after a couple uses, to the point the edge was brittle and breaking. Definitely not true stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon M.

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp and lightweight with flex. Excellent knife and the case keeps it protected.
customer_reviews.author: B. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: fillet away
customer_reviews.text: i would like to thank the folks at kershaw for there superior knifes and most of all for this wonderful 9" fillet knife i purchased just a few weeks ago and may i say its every fishermans dream : i just fillet,d 158.lbs of shark meat and 394 lbs of tuna an not once did i have to stop and sharpen the blade, i am buying 12 more knifes just like this one : thank you thank you thank you kershaw folks , i hope you guys never stop making this fillet knife ever...
customer_reviews.author: mamagordota

customer_reviews.title: Nice blade/handle. Easy to sharpen
customer_reviews.text: Good solid blade. Nice comfortable handle. Not as flexible as I’d like but it still works quite nicely! Cheap plastic sheathe but it does it’s job.
customer_reviews.author: D'Lacey

customer_reviews.title: I love this fillet knife
customer_reviews.text: I love this fillet knife, this is the second one I have purchased (lost the original). Clean cuts and great control. The hard plastic sheath with a drain makes cleaning it easy and lets you throw it in with the rest of your gear and not worry about the knife or your gear.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan P. Toye

customer_reviews.title: Product arrived as expected
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace one I already had! Arrived on time.
customer_reviews.author: naomi

customer_reviews.title: easy to sharpen
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat these mofo's Sharp outta the box, easy to sharpen, med edge. =perfect compromise. Try one The plastic sheath fits dead on.
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain
customer_reviews.text: I like it! A real Kershaw! It has a non-slip handle, which is very important for using a knife this sharp, while working on slippery, rubbery fish meat.
customer_reviews.author: kewalo surfer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp and works great for the price. They are better fillet knives but much more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Carter

customer_reviews.title: Razor sharp, good grip
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-balanced, well-made filet knife. Like most, it's super lightweight, holds a very sharp edge and just glides through Salmon flesh. The handle is a tough and very grippy rubber. It comes with a stiff plastic sheath that protects the edge and point very well. I love this knife especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: CheeseMouse

customer_reviews.title: Take it from me
customer_reviews.text: Very long. Blade become dull almost instantly and needed sharpening upon arrival. Spend the money for a better knife, I should’ve.
customer_reviews.author: Barnald Obamump

customer_reviews.title: Good, but too long for me.
customer_reviews.text: The knife itself is good, but I shouldn't have gotten one so long. I use it to fillet fish and would definitely recommend something shorter, as it'd be much easier to navigate.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't believe that as cheap as this was, that it was so sharp! My husband fishes & this knife is a great help to him.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the sharpest knife in the drawer
customer_reviews.text: This knife has never been especially sharp. I don't typically filet fish, but it seems to me that the knife should be super sharp. I can hardly cut anything with this knife.
customer_reviews.author: eskieme

customer_reviews.title: Sharp
customer_reviews.text: This knife is wicked sharp. Very very sharp. So sharp that while cleaning, it I sliced a hole through my index finger- it’s still healing months later! Great knife for scaling a big fish over 20 inches, it feels unwieldy otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Keegan

customer_reviews.title: My son is happy
customer_reviews.text: My 30 yr old son said "it's the sharpest knife I have ever felt".
customer_reviews.author: Theresa P.

customer_reviews.title: You should have seen the one that got away!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good knife for the price, but not perfect. Also, I screwed up and bought a fillet knife more at home with a giant salon or something. Way too big for the small, pan fish I catch in the pond.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Garn

customer_reviews.title: Knife is nice with sheath
customer_reviews.text: Knife is nice with sheath. Larger than I expected. I would probably choose a smaller size, but, that is the only con I can think of. But my fault for not thinking.
customer_reviews.author: Gale E.

customer_reviews.title: Great knife, stays sharp!
customer_reviews.text: The knife was a little dull whenever it arrived, I had read some other reviews complaining about the same thing so I ordered it together with a Lanskey 4 Stone Sharpening System. After a good 20° sharpening with the Lanskey, the knife is now razor sharp and cuts through any fish with ease. It does not need to be constantly sharpened in-between filleting jobs like the previous knife I was using.
customer_reviews.author: PC Tech

customer_reviews.title: Nice knife
customer_reviews.text: I used this for making beef jerky, and it worked great. I was able to make thin strips so it worked out great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall? Coming from a chef... Dependable ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall? Coming from a chef... Dependable blade 🔪... I am picky!!! ... Did sharpen it even further .. But a tough base blade and well worth the price...!!!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Chamberlain

customer_reviews.title: Love the sleeve for safety
customer_reviews.text: Awessome fillet knife for the boat. Love the sleeve for safety!!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Wesner

customer_reviews.title: Love me some Kershaw blades!
customer_reviews.text: Gave as a gift but hubby loved it and I was impressed with the quality of the blade we will see how it holds up against the bubba blade this next salmon season the test is on! But my $ is one the Kershaw! 😉 lol! !
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Hoyt-Berg

customer_reviews.title: Not Sharp!
customer_reviews.text: I’m very disappointed. Knife was not sharp as advertised. Tried filleting a 20 lb. salmon and the first time the knife did ok, but a week later with the same size salmon the knife wouldn’t cut and instead ripped the meat to shreds.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hargrove

customer_reviews.title: Nice, long fillet knife
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with this knife. I just make sure to wash and wipe it right away instead of letting it sit in the sink in the water
customer_reviews.author: TrollHntr

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful fillet knife
customer_reviews.text: Long blade and fairly stiff also. It did not come as sharp as I would have liked it but with some sharpening it is a great fillet knife. The case is a little bulky but keeps you and your knife protected.
customer_reviews.author: Brayden

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sharp right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sharp right out of the box, i cut my self first time so be carefull. Makes preparing fish a breeze. The sheath that comes with it is nice because that way when its not being used you dont have to worry about getting poked when you reach for it in the drawer.
customer_reviews.author: brian eckert

customer_reviews.title: Great shape but doesn't hold an edge.
customer_reviews.text: I love the size and shape of this knife for cleaning salmon, but it does not stay sharp for long at all. Need to constantly sharpen blade. Handle is easy to grip when hands are wet/covered in fish slime.
customer_reviews.author: JNB

customer_reviews.title: Shapest filet knife I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Shapest filet knife I have ever used. I trust Kershaw for quality and performance. This knife is priced absolutely perfectly for the job.
customer_reviews.author: Rob J.

customer_reviews.title: Great knife
customer_reviews.text: Great knife for the price. Cleaned over 150 fish with it and I can hit it on the steel and it will still shave hairs off my arm. I cut through the rib cage and pin bones too. The tip didn't come very sharp though. I used the lansky system on the top 1/3 of the knife and the bottom 2/3 is factory sharpened.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good fillet knife. Could be sharper.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Was not as sharp out of the box as I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Knife seems nice..
customer_reviews.text: Knife seems nice.....but it does nit fit in three case well. Was debating toys one to the Swiss....thinking I should have gone Swiss.
customer_reviews.author: Noobjew

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: good blade- I go through about 1 every other year
customer_reviews.author: mark van hook

customer_reviews.title: Good knife
customer_reviews.text: I use it to trim salmon. Very sharp. Good quality. Hope it stays sharp
customer_reviews.author: Alaska

customer_reviews.title: Keeping your edge.
customer_reviews.text: This 9" blade Kershaw fillet knife from Amazon is flexible enough to follow the bone curvature without leaving meat behind but does not wobble when you make a hard straight cut. The blade maintains it edge very well.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin S. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp knife that easily cuts thru fish bone
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp knife that easily cuts thru fish bone. We actually use this to cut up meats like chicken, goat, and beef. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amoideen

customer_reviews.title: If you buy it, you have to sharpen it first
customer_reviews.text: This review is from Frank, husband of the account holder. Like most products made in China, this fillet knife is a piece of garbage. The blade is so dull and smooth it will not cut a piece of twine. Do not buy this piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Nolan Ingoglia

customer_reviews.title: The 9inch blade is quiet long but it's a strong ...
customer_reviews.text: The 9inch blade is quiet long but it's a strong and sharp knife. My husband used this fillet knife to cut up venison and it worked well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nce Knife
customer_reviews.text: Good knife for larger fish. Hope it holds an edge as well as my other fillet knives.
customer_reviews.author: Zee

customer_reviews.title: Made in China, not the USA as stated in ad.
customer_reviews.text: Knife is fine, but made in China, not the USA as stated in ad.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Slappy

customer_reviews.title: Not made in the USA as description claimed.
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed in this item as I purchased it over other brands because the description said it was made in the USA. When I recieved the item today, it says on the box it was made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Brad J Siefert

customer_reviews.title: Used this knife to filet hundreds of fish so far ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this knife to filet hundreds of fish so far, with routine sharpening and cleaning this knife will last and stay sharp!!
customer_reviews.author: justin kemp

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Longer than I expected. Was thinking overall length but blade was 7in. my fault.
customer_reviews.author: Bondo Bob

customer_reviews.title: Was not razor sharp out of the package but takes ...
customer_reviews.text: Was not razor sharp out of the package but takes a keen edge. Have cleaned many crappie with this and edge retention and the overall quality of the knife are superb.
customer_reviews.author: Ollbuster

customer_reviews.title: REALLY SHARP AND LONG GREAT FOR ANYTHING FROM FILLETING TO EVEN CUTTING MEATS THE ...
customer_reviews.text: REALLY SHARP AND LONG GREAT FOR ANYTHING FROM FILLETING TO EVEN CUTTING MEATS THE EDGE ON IT LAST QUITE A BIT BUT AFTER HEAVY MEAT CUTTING ALL YOU NEED TO DO IS HONE IT A BIT AND BACK TO RAZOR SHARP.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto B

customer_reviews.title: Sharp knife!
customer_reviews.text: Great filet knife. Very sharp! I love this knife. The handle is very comfortable and slices like no other.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnie Math

customer_reviews.title: Nice knife.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift to my wife. She loves using filet knives versus other knives because they are sharp and easy to hold.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin Casion

customer_reviews.title: Came in razor sharp and so easy to sharpen
customer_reviews.text: Came in razor sharp and so easy to sharpen. The handle is comfortable and the blade flexes perfectly. I love it !
customer_reviews.author: Makoa Maui

customer_reviews.title: Husband Loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband. We eat a lot of fish but I always get the job of filleting the fish. Not any more. My husband loves his knife and enjoys filleting the fish. Win win situation.
customer_reviews.author: For the LOVE of Tennis

customer_reviews.title: Very flexible blade
customer_reviews.text: Good fillet knife for the money. Very flexible blade. Stays fairly sharp. Sharpens up nicely. I use 2 or 3 knives when cleaning fish because a dull knife makes the job harder. I always like the feel of this knife every time I pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Friedman

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it very sharp just need to catch a fish lol
customer_reviews.author: Brialer

customer_reviews.title: Wow ordered and delivery 1 day only a 10$ good quality really happy
customer_reviews.text: Wow ordered and delivery 1 day only a 10$ good quality really happy
customer_reviews.author: J. Hides

customer_reviews.title: You need to get a good edge on it before you start using it.
customer_reviews.text: You can not buy better knife for the price. Absolutely love this knife.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D.

customer_reviews.title: It's a knife
customer_reviews.text: Arrived extremely dull. However it was easy to sharpen. This knife is huge and in retrospect I should have bought a 7". It is also not as flexible as my 5", very thick at the shank and stiff until the last 2".
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice and flexible blade makes filleting easy. Its sharp and holds its edge well.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Made in China.....disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Description say made in the USA. It is actually made in China. I like Kershaw knives and wanted to buy a good fillet knive.
customer_reviews.author: Jared D.

customer_reviews.title: Kershaw Fillet Knife (9 inch blade)
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Kershaw Knive from amazon.com. I have used it now about six times and each time on about a dozen crappie or bass. It has a great feel to it. Fit's my hand just right and the grip is solid, doesn't slip around. It's very sharp and will slice thru the bones good. So far I haven't sharpened it any. I would recommend it to anyone wanting a excellent fillet knife.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Nice bend to it. Great for filleting fish.

customer_reviews.title: Great filet knife
customer_reviews.text: I have bought five of these for myself and family in the past few years. They are great kinives for our northwest salmon.

customer_reviews.title: LOOKS LIKE A GREAT VALUE AND IT FEELS VERY SHARP
customer_reviews.text: LOOKS LIKE A GREAT VALUE AND IT FEELS VERY SHARP. BUT I HAVE NOT USED IT YET; IT TOO DAMN COLD IN MICHIGAN DURING JANUARY TO GO FISHING.

product_meta.title: Kershaw Clearwater 9-In Fillet Knife (1259X) Fixed 420J2 High-Performance Stainless Steel Blade with Satin Finish, Black Textured Co-Polymer Handle with Neon-Green Detail and Included Sheath; 3.8 OZ
product_meta.description:
Style Name:9 InchKershaw’s Clearwater 9-inch fillet is perfect for filleting larger fish with ease. The blade is made of Japanese 420J2 stainless steel with the perfect degree of flex to make detailed jobs simple. This “softer” steel enables the blade to bend without breaking so it moves easily through the body of the fish, rendering the ideal fillet. It is also highly corrosion resistant for work in wet environments, without rust or buildup. The handle, made of co-polymer material, is durable, contoured for comfort and textured for tough grip that’s soft-yet-firm, making filleting even a large catch less fatiguing. Its neon green highlights make the handle easy to spot in a marine environment, while adding stylish contrast to the basic black handle. The 9-inch fillet’s handle design, with its central contour and hand protectors at both ends, fits the hand and locks in for extra-comfortable grip. The Kershaw 9-inch Clearwater Fillet locks into its own ABS sheath for secure storage or easy belt carry.

AMAZON.COM
Kershaw 1259 Fillet Knife with Nine-Inch Blade features a stainless steel blade and co-polymer plastic handle. This fillet knife has a total length of 14.25 inches and weighs a total of 3.8 ounces. An ABS sheath is included.

 About Kershaw Knives
Since the company's founding in 1974, Kershaw Knives has been dedicated to quality that has led to a worldwide reputation for performance and innovation in tools and knives. From state-of-the-art manufacturing to advanced materials, customers rely on Kershaw for products that provide "technology with an edge." Today, Kershaw is a wholly owned subsidiary of Kai Corporation--for over 90 years. Japan's premier blade producer. Kai's innovative approach to product development has resulted in over 10,000 superior products.

 Manufacturer's Warranty
Limited lifetime warranty
feature_bullets: 9” fixed blade made of 420J2 stainless steel is resistant to corrosion and includes an ABS sheath with belt holster for safe storage
Soft textured, co-polymer rubber grip for a comfortable in-hand feel that won’t slip and neon-green accents for identifying in a marine environment
Excellent knife for filleting larger fresh and salt-water fish alike, including tilapia, salmon, snapper, tuna, snapper, carp, eel, bass, catfish and cod
Keep handy in boats, tackle boxes, trucks, backpacks, on belts or in the kitchen
Softer blade steel is designed to bend without breaking, easily slicing through the body of a fish for the ideal fillet every time
